sentence: I welcome the end of no-excuse mail-in voting in Pennsylvania,? said Doug Mastriano, a Republican state senator who is also running for governor, in a statement.
title: Pennsylvania Court Says States Mail Voting Law Is Unconstitutional

sentence: One Republican candidate, state Sen. Doug Mastriano, supports a ban at six weeks of pregnancy without exceptions for rape, incest or saving the life of the mother.

sentence: Meanwhile, in the GOP primary for the state's gubernatorial race, Sen. Doug Mastriano (R), who Trump endorsed Saturday, is up against former Rep. Lou Barletta (R-Pa.), Montgomery County commissioner Joseph Gale, former U.S. Attorney William McSwain and Ridley Township Commissioner Dave White, among other candidates.

title: Sunday shows preview: Democrats' abortion rights bill blocked; Pennsylvania, N.C. primaries near

sentence: One of those bills, a six-week ban that would effectively block the majority of abortions, was introduced in the state Senate by Doug Mastriano, a candidate endorsed by former President Trump who is leading the field heading into Tuesdays Republican gubernatorial primary.

title: Pennsylvania governors race could have outsize impact on abortion access

sentence: ]Lisa Desjardins: Yesterday, Republicans chose one of their most conservative candidates, state Senator Doug Mastriano, bolstered by a last-minute endorsement from former President Donald Trump.

title: Abortion access becomes central issue in Pennsylvanias race for governor
